items.longDescription:
UT ARCHIVE Andy Warhol / Keith Haring / Jean-Michel Basquiat

“UT Archive” is a project that revives carefully selected T-shirts which have been sold in the past. From the UT collection that has been on sale for about 20 years, popular patterns by Andy Warhol, Basquiat, and Keith Haring will be re-released.

Andy Warhol
As the preeminent American artist of the 20th Century, Andy Warhol challenged the world to see art differently. This product is produced under a license from The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc., a New York not-for-profit corporation which promotes the visual arts.

Keith Haring
A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,”with abstract marks and patterning.

Jean-Michel Basquiat
An icon of New York in the 1980s, Jean-Michel Basquiat became renowned during his short career for works inspired by his early street art and a distinctive iconography often connected to art history. His paintings, drawings, and prints drew on a diverse range of sources, from African, Aztec, and Greek cultures to Americana in the form of jazz, baseball, and social and political events.

©/®/™ The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc.
© Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
© Estate of Jean-Michel Basquiat. Licensed by Artestar, New York.

items.longDescription:
This t-shirt was designed by Gosho Aoyama, the author of the original manga. It features heart-warming illustrations of Heiji Hattori, a high school detective from western Japan, and his childhood friend Kazuha Toyama. Hidden in the front pocket is the charm of their memories, related to the episode "The Whereabouts of the Embarrassing Charm".

Introduction of Detective Conan (Case Closed)

After solving a case, high school detective Shinichi Kudo witnessed men dressed all in black engaging in suspicious activity. In an attempt to silence him, they force-fed him a mysterious drug that caused his body to shrink to that of a first grader. Gosho Aoyama's mystery manga "Detective Conan (Case Closed)", which began serialization in "Weekly Shonen Sunday" in 1994, is now a very popular manga with more than 100 volumes. This original design, featuring fan-favorite scenes and art, are available only at UNIQLO.

©Gosho Aoyama/Shogakukan

Fujiko・F・Fujio 90th Anniversary

Fujiko・F・Fujio created many masterpieces including "DORAEMON". This time, UT has designed graphic T-shirts featuring famous characters and scenes from his many works. This is a commemorative collection featuring special art for the 90th anniversary and art from his original works.

Fujiko・F・Fujio
Birth name, Hiroshi Fujimoto. Born on December 1st, 1933, in Takaoka-city of Toyama Prefecture, Fujimoto made his professional debut as a manga artist in 1951. Having moved to Tokyo with his friend, Motoo Abiko, in 1954, they formally started writing under the joint pen name "Fujiko Fujio". After the dissolution of their partnership in 1987, Fujimoto continued writing under the "Fujiko・F・Fujio" pseudonym, and built a new era of manga aimed at children. DORAEMON, his most renowned manga series, has been translated into 17 languages and appears in 20 different countries/regions, as it continues to be read by children all around the world.

©Fujiko-Pro

Andy Warhol’s Collages

Andy Warhol's acetate collages showcase his innovative artistic genius. With meticulous precision, he artfully layered translucent sheets to create vibrant colors, bold patterns, and captivating imagery. These visually stunning compositions bring depth and texture to his iconic Pop Art images such as Mick Jagger, blurring boundaries and revealing Warhol's innovative spirit in capturing the influence of mass media on society.

Andy Warhol
As the preeminent American artist of the 20th Century, Andy Warhol challenged the world to see art differently. This product is produced under a license from The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc., a New York not-for-profit corporation which promotes the visual arts.

©/®/™ The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc.

"Hakkai Brewery" continues to produce "clean sake" unique to the Minamiuonuma region’s rich nature and snowy culture. The label design on the T-shirt depicts the characteristic rocky peaks and sea of clouds of the famous mountain "Hakkaisan," from which the name is derived.

The SAKE Collection

This collection showcases Japan's leading sake breweries Ishizuchi, Katsuyama, Hakkaisan, and Bijofu. Designs inspired by the symbolic designs of each sake brewery have been incorporated into the T-shirts.

This piece features artwork of KAWS' popular pink BFF character on the back print. One point on the front is a design of XX, the trademark of KAWS artwork.

Uniqlo proudly presents the World’s Premier of KAWS newest artbook (Publisher: Phaidon). Launching Together: UT exclusive collection featuring original artwork designed in conjunction with KAWS art book release. Experience the cutting-edge fusion of artbook and T-shirts combined in an exciting new way.

KAWS
KAWS engages audiences far beyond the museums and galleries in which he regularly exhibits. Over the last two decades, KAWS has built a successful career with work that consistently shows his formal agility as an artist, as well as his underlying wit, irreverence, and affection for our times. He has collaborated extensively with UNIQLO, including by providing designs for the PEACE FOR ALL charity project in 2022, which was a huge worldwide success.

© KAWS

items.longDescription:
Founded in 1752, the Daishichi Sake Brewery in Nihonmatsu, Fukushima Prefecture, is highly regarded for its consistent use of the traditional Kimoto method and innovative superflat rice polishing technology. Daishichi's sakes have a sophisticated taste and have won worldwide acclaim as the ideal sake to pair with fine food. Celebrated by the world, they have opened a new chapter in the history of superior sake.

The SAKE Collection

This collaboration was realized with prestigious brands that have been in business for over 100 years, such as Nanbu Bijin, Dewazakura, Daishichi and Kenbishi, selected from hundreds of sake breweries. Inspired by the signboards and aprons of the Edo period, we incorporated elements that are synonymous with the graphic designs of Edo Kiriko (cut glass) and Yosegi-zaiku (wooden mosaic work) into the T-shirts.

Star Wars is a brand cherished worldwide. Artist Kosuke Kawamura has reimagined the iconic poster graphics that have emerged over its long history. Enjoy the fusion of a galactic worldview and the artistic collage concept, with the aim of creating vintage T-shirts for the next generation.

Star Wars: A New Hope was released in 1977. This is the fourth film of the nine Skywalker Saga Films that has fascinated several generations of moviegoers for decades. The key visual from this memorable film is boldly designed on the back of this piece. On the front, the iconic Star Wars logo is placed.

Star Wars: Remastered by Kosuke Kawamura

Star Wars is a brand cherished worldwide. Artist Kosuke Kawamura has reimagined the iconic poster graphics that have emerged over its long history. Enjoy the fusion of a galactic worldview and the artistic collage concept, with the aim of creating vintage T-shirts for the next generation.

Kosuke Kawamura Kawamura was born in Hiroshima in 1979. His work as a collage artist has led to a variety of creative projects, from solo exhibitions around the world to corporate collaborations. He became the Creative Director of UT in 2022.

Kaiju No.8

items.longDescription:
Jacob's Ladder
1957

For this collection, we have selected Post-Impressionism and Abstract artworks to inspire our designs. The design for this piece is based on the work "Jacob's Ladder" (1957) by Helen Frankenthaler, one of the most famous painters of the 20th century. She utilized the soak-stain painting technique, which is used in this work that measures 287.9 x 177.5 cm, making it a large and powerful work and a fan favorite at MoMA. To convey the work's size, the design is printed prominently on the back, and the white body color implies a white gallery wall.

MoMA Art Icons

This latest collection was created by The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) and UNIQLO through our partnership. We selected some of our favorite works from MoMA's extensive collection and reimagined them for everyday wear.

Helen Frankenthaler

© 2023 Helen Frankenthaler Foundation, Inc. / Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York
The Museum of Modern Art, MoMA, and related elements are trademarks of The Museum of Modern Art.

Jean-Michel Basquiat
An icon of New York in the 1980s, Jean-Michel Basquiat became renowned during his short career for works inspired by his early street art and a distinctive iconography often connected to art history. His paintings, drawings, and prints drew on a diverse range of sources, from African, Aztec, and Greek cultures to Americana in the form of jazz, baseball, and social and political events.

items.longDescription:
Hokusai Remixed

Ukiyo-e prints were produced through a three-step process: the artist draws the image, a craftsman carves the woodblocks, and a printer applies pigments to the woodblocks and prints them on Japanese paper. As a result, many ukiyo-e works share the same motif but vary in textures and colors. This collection is made by reconstructing many of Katsushika Hokusai's Ukiyo-e works produced in this way.

items.longDescription:
UNIQLO and Marimekko are pleased to announce the new limited-edition collection just in time for a joyful summer sun. The new collection offers a wide array of breezy, comfortable dress, cut and sewn and skirt made in cotton and linen, along with hats, shoes, and bags for easy coordination. This collection features Marimekko’s world-renowned prints: Melooni (melon), Ruukku (pot) by Maija Isola, Lirinä (sound of gurgling water), Asema (station) by Pentti Rinta, along with Demeter by Katsuji Wakisaka and Galleria (gallery) by Vuokko Eskolin-Nurmesniemi. These vibrant and colorful patterns, full of the feeling of summer fun, are available for women, kids, and babies.

- 100% cotton.
- Sleeveless, V-neck design.
- Voluminous A-line silhouette.
- With convenient pockets.
*Please note that pattern placement may differ from the photo. Your understanding is appreciated.
